timeline.message:
LUCENE-9541 ConjunctionDISI sub-iterators check

Ensure sub-iterators of a conjuction iterator don't advance outside
of it.
Add assertions for checking that all sub-iterators are always on the
same document.

timeline.bodyText: @jpountz  Is this a correct assumption?  or could we start with iterators that are not on the same document?
timeline.author: mayya-sharipova

replies.bodyText: this is the invariant between iterations indeed
replies.author: jpountz

timeline.author: jpountz

timeline.bodyText: can we avoid iterating over all sub iterators unless assertions are enabled?
timeline.author: jpountz

timeline.bodyText: I think we need to call something like assumeTrue(assertsAreEnabled) since this test requires assertions to be enabled to succeed.
timeline.author: jpountz

replies.bodyText: Thanks @jpountz, very good point, addressed in bf9a3e8
replies.author: mayya-sharipova

timeline.bodyText: can you revert the two arguments to assertEquals? it expects the expected value first and the actual value second. While swapping arguments doesn't cause major issues, it creates confusing error messages when the assertion fails.
timeline.author: jpountz

replies.bodyText: Thanks @jpountz, my mistake, addressed in bf9a3e8
replies.author: mayya-sharipova
